alert.note: Alert for Belmont; Guernsey; Monroe; Noble (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pittsburgh (Western Pennsylvania and East Central Ohio)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 20 at 10:24AM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT SOUTHEASTERN GUERNSEY... NORTHWESTERN MONROE...SOUTHWESTERN BELMONT AND NORTHEASTERN NOBLE COUNTIES THROUGH 1100 AM EDT... At 1024 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Byesville, or 9 miles southeast of Cambridge, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Barnesville, Bethesda, Quaker City, Senecaville, Lore City, Morristown, Old Washington, Jerusalem, Salesville, Somerton, Fairview, and Batesville. This includes Interstate 70 in Ohio between mile markers 183 and 207. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
